conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically only with patient consent (implying controlled or limited sharing), while User Story B demands ALFRED to share all personal health data freely, which contradicts the consent-based controlled sharing in User Story A.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight respectfully.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance patient consent requirements with broader data sharing by defining consent-based controlled sharing that includes necessary personal health data for personalized care.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress and share data only with patient consent, so I can maintain respectful clinical oversight.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share personal health data with consent, so I can benefit from personalized care while preserving my privacy.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires automatic monitoring of cognitive game progress only with patient consent, implying monitoring can be restricted, while User Story B mandates automatic continuous monitoring and sharing of all health data without restriction, creating a conflict between conditional monitoring and unconditional monitoring.
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight respectfully.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: Updated User Story A to specify monitoring only with explicit patient consent and limited data sharing, while keeping User Story B to allow continuous monitoring for users who opt-in fully, thus respecting consent and continuous monitoring preferences.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress only with patient consent and limited data sharing, so I can maintain respectful clinical oversight.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically (start monitoring), while User Story B requires ALFRED to block all chatting with other users during games (forbid social interactions), which includes blocking communication features that may be part of monitoring or data collection during games, thus imposing opposing instructions for system behavior during the same event (game playing).
userStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight respectfully.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult I want ALFRED to block all chatting with other users during games to protect my privacy and avoid all social interactions.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: Updated User Story B to allow monitoring features that do not involve chatting, preserving privacy while enabling clinical oversight.
newUserStoryASummary: As a medical caregiver, I want ALFRED to monitor cognitive game progress automatically with patient consent, so I can maintain clinical oversight respectfully.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to block all chatting during games to protect my privacy, except for necessary monitoring communications.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires accessing patient health data offline only when permitted by privacy settings, implying restricted access under some conditions, while User Story B demands ALFRED to share all personal health data freely without restrictions. These impose incompatible constraints on data sharing and access.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data offline when permitted by privacy settings, so I can monitor patients responsibly.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify that offline access to patient health data is allowed only under strict privacy controls, while User Story B remains to promote sharing data freely but within consented privacy boundaries, reconciling the conflict by emphasizing controlled sharing.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want to access patient health data offline only when privacy settings allow, so I can monitor patients responsibly and securely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A restricts offline data access based on privacy settings (implying controlled or limited access), while User Story B demands automatic continuous monitoring and sharing of all health data, which contradicts any restriction or forbidding of data sharing under certain conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to access patient health data offline when permitted by privacy settings, so I can monitor patients responsibly.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: The conflict is resolved by refining User Story A to clarify offline access is subject to privacy permissions and User Story B to specify continuous sharing occurs only with explicit consent, balancing privacy and monitoring needs.
newUserStoryASummary: As a nurse, I want offline access to patient health data when privacy settings allow, to monitor responsibly.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to continuously monitor and share health data only with my consent, so I stay informed.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual selective viewing of only essential health data (implying restriction), while User Story B requires sharing all personal health data freely; these impose mutually exclusive operations regarding data sharing and viewing under the same system conditions.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually select and view only essential health data on my dashboard to protect privacy and prevent overload.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: Adjust User Story A to specify selective viewing with configurable sharing permissions, while keeping User Story B as full data sharing, allowing privacy control and full care benefits concurrently.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to selectively view essential health data with configurable sharing controls, so that privacy is respected and data overload is prevented.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual selection and viewing of only essential health data to protect privacy, effectively forbidding continuous automatic sharing, while User Story B mandates continuous automatic monitoring and sharing of all health data, creating a direct contradiction on data sharing behavior.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to manually select and view only essential health data on my dashboard to protect privacy and prevent overload.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: The conflict is resolved by refining both user stories to allow manual selection of essential data while enabling continuous monitoring with configurable privacy controls.

newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want continuous automatic health data monitoring with configurable sharing options, so that I stay informed while maintaining privacy.

userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share personal health data freely with consent, enabling personalized care and support.

userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.

userStoryBSummary: As an older adult I want ALFRED to block all chatting with other users during games to protect my privacy and avoid all social interactions.

userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what non-critical data to record and share, while critical health data is automatically shared to respect privacy and support care.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids sharing all data by allowing manual choice to respect privacy, while User Story B requires sharing all health data for personalized support, creating a strict contradiction on data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what data to record and share when monitoring multiple clients remotely to fully respect their privacy preferences.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow manual data sharing choices within predefined privacy-preserving defaults, while User Story B remains to use shared data for personalized support, balancing privacy and personalization.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to configure privacy-preserving defaults for data sharing, so that clients privacy is respected while enabling monitoring.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires leaving messages that respect client privacy and preferences, implying restricted sharing of personal health data, while User Story B demands all personal health data to be shared freely. These impose opposite expectations on data sharing under the same conditions, creating a forbid-stop conflict.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to leave messages respecting client privacy and preferences, so communications remain confidential.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify privacy-respecting data sharing under explicit user consent, allowing User Story B to remain with free data sharing to enhance personalized care.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to leave messages respecting client privacy and preferences under user consent, so communications remain confidential.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A emphasizes respecting client privacy and preferences by limiting message sharing, while User Story B mandates continuous automatic sharing of all health data, which directly contradicts the privacy constraint under all circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to leave messages respecting client privacy and preferences, so communications remain confidential.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow automatic sharing of health data only with explicit user consent and privacy controls, respecting confidentiality while enabling support. User Story B remains the same to preserve continuous monitoring benefits.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want messages to respect client privacy and share health data only with their consent, so communications remain confidential.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires sending formal messages respecting client privacy, implying communication is allowed, while User Story B forbids any chatting with other users during games, which is a communication operation. These impose opposite expectations on system behavior regarding communication.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to leave messages respecting client privacy and preferences, so communications remain confidential.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult I want ALFRED to block all chatting with other users during games to protect my privacy and avoid all social interactions.
resolutionDescription: A context-aware policy is applied where chatting is allowed only for formal caregiver messages respecting privacy, while informal or social chatting during games is blocked to protect privacy.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to send formal messages respecting client privacy, so communications remain confidential and controlled.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to block informal chatting with other users during games to protect my privacy and avoid unwanted social interactions.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires sharing health data only with explicit consent to protect privacy, effectively forbidding data sharing without approval, while User Story B mandates sharing all personal health data freely. These two are mutually exclusive under the same conditions, representing a forbid-stop conflict.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities that I can approve and share only with explicit consent, so I can promote wellbeing while fully protecting privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to specify that data sharing requires explicit consent except for cases where sharing is essential for personalized care, thus aligning with User Story B which mandates free sharing for care benefits.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to share health data only with explicit consent unless necessary for personalized care, so privacy is protected while enabling support.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires explicit consent before sharing health data to protect privacy, effectively forbidding continuous automatic sharing. User Story B mandates continuous automatic sharing of all health data, which directly conflicts with the explicit consent requirement, making these requirements mutually exclusive.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities that I can approve and share only with explicit consent, so I can promote wellbeing while fully protecting privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: The conflict is resolved by balancing privacy and automatic sharing: requiring explicit consent before sharing while allowing automatic monitoring and sharing with user-controlled preferences.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities and share health data only with explicit user consent to protect privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor health data and share it continuously when consent is granted to stay informed.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires that suggestions and sharing of mild outdoor activities occur only with explicit consent to fully protect privacy, effectively forbidding unsolicited data sharing. User Story B requires using all shared health data to provide personalized recommendations, implying broad data sharing and use without such restrictive consent, creating opposite expectations on data sharing behavior.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities that I can approve and share only with explicit consent, so I can promote wellbeing while fully protecting privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify that explicit consent is required for sharing data for suggestions, while User Story B remains the same to allow use of shared health data only after consent, resolving the conflict by enforcing consent as a prerequisite.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest mild outdoor activities only after explicit user consent, so privacy is fully protected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids unauthorized data sharing by strictly mediating communications according to privacy preferences, while User Story B requires sharing all personal health data freely. These impose opposite expectations on data sharing behavior under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate communications according to privacy preferences, ensuring no unauthorized data sharing.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow data sharing only with explicit user consent, balancing privacy mediation and personalized care needs, while User Story B remains to emphasize the benefit of sharing data for care.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to mediate data sharing according to explicit user consent, ensuring privacy is respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids unauthorized data sharing under any circumstances to respect privacy, while User Story B requires continuous automatic sharing of all health data. These requirements contradict because one mandates sharing data and the other forbids it entirely.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate communications according to privacy preferences, ensuring no unauthorized data sharing.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: Clarify privacy-driven mediation and enable automatic data sharing only with explicit user consent, balancing privacy and continuous support.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate data sharing based on explicit user consent, ensuring privacy is respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically share health data only with my approval for continuous support.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires ALFRED to strictly mediate communications and prevent unauthorized data sharing, effectively forbidding certain data sharing operations, while User Story B requires ALFRED to use all shared health data freely to provide personalized support, which contradicts the strict mediation and forbidding of data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate communications according to privacy preferences, ensuring no unauthorized data sharing.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to specify mediation with explicit user consent, allowing authorized data sharing; User Story B remains unchanged to enable personalized support using shared data.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want ALFRED to strictly mediate communications and only share health data with explicit user consent, ensuring privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires strict control over data sharing to preserve privacy and trust (effectively forbidding free sharing), while User Story B requires sharing all personal health data freely for personalized care, imposing opposite and mutually exclusive expectations on data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want strict control over data sharing, so that client privacy and trust are preserved.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
resolutionDescription: Balancing privacy and personalized care by introducing controlled, consent-based data sharing, allowing personalization without unrestricted free sharing.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want controlled data sharing with user consent, so that client privacy and trust are preserved.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share my personal health data selectively with consent, so that I benefit from personalized care.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires strict control over data sharing to preserve privacy and trust, effectively forbidding unrestricted sharing, while User Story B mandates automatic continuous sharing of all health data, creating a direct contradiction on whether data sharing should occur under all circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want strict control over data sharing, so that client privacy and trust are preserved.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to specify controlled and consent-based data sharing, allowing automatic continuous sharing only with user consent, preserving privacy while enabling support. User Story B remains as is, emphasizing continuous sharing.

newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids broad data sharing to preserve strict privacy and trust, while User Story B requires sharing all health data to enable personalized support, which is incompatible under the same conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want strict control over data sharing, so that client privacy and trust are preserved.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.
resolutionDescription: Clarify data sharing boundaries by specifying strict privacy control with selective sharing for personalized support, balancing privacy and personalization.

newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use selectively shared health data, so that I receive personalized and challenging support.

userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFRED's prompts when patients ignore them, respecting their consent and boundaries.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to clarify that control over prompts and data sharing respects patient consent and privacy, while User Story B remains to emphasize free sharing of personal health data for personalized care within consent boundaries.

newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A implies controlling (and possibly restricting) ALFRED's prompts respecting patient consent and boundaries, which may forbid continuous automatic monitoring and sharing of health data as desired in User Story B. userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to allow controlled and consent-respecting health data sharing, balancing continuous monitoring in User Story B.

newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual control to restrict sharing of health data to protect privacy, effectively forbidding automatic data sharing. User Story B requires sharing all personal health data freely to enable full personalized care, thereby mandating unrestricted data sharing on the same triggering event of data sharing, which are opposite expectations.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what health data is logged and shared to fully respect my clients' privacy and autonomy.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
generalResolutionType: 2. Update one and keep one remain the same
resolutionDescription: User Story A is updated to specify manual control with context-aware privacy settings allowing selective sharing, while User Story B remains to emphasize full data sharing to enhance personalized care under explicit consent.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually control health data sharing with privacy settings, so that client autonomy and consent are respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids automatic continuous sharing of health data by requiring manual choice for data logging and sharing, while User Story B mandates automatic continuous monitoring and sharing of all health data, which is strictly forbidden by User Story A.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what health data is logged and shared to fully respect my clients' privacy and autonomy.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow automatic health data monitoring with user-controlled sharing preferences, balancing continuous support with privacy respect.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want users to control health data sharing preferences to respect privacy and autonomy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to monitor health data automatically while allowing me to manage sharing settings for full support.

conflictDescription: User Story A forbids sharing health data without manual choice to preserve privacy and autonomy, while User Story B mandates using all shared health data for personalized support, creating a direct contradiction on data sharing permissions.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose what health data is logged and shared to fully respect my clients' privacy and autonomy.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.
resolutionDescription: Adjusted both user stories to establish explicit manual data sharing consent and allow personalized support only on explicitly shared data, reconciling privacy and personalization.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to manually select health data to share, so that clients' privacy and autonomy are fully respected.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to use only my manually shared health data to provide personalized and supportive care.

conflictDescription: User Story A seeks to control and limit ALFREDs social features to protect privacy and prevent unwanted interactions, effectively forbidding unrestricted sharing, while User Story B demands that all personal health data be shared freely for full care benefits. These requirements impose mutually exclusive constraints on data sharing.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFREDs social features to honor each clients privacy and prevent unwanted interactions, so I can support meaningful connections safely.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
resolutionDescription: Balanced sharing policies are introduced to protect privacy while enabling essential health data access for care, respecting both privacy control and care needs.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to control ALFREDs social features to limit personal data sharing, so privacy is respected during interactions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to share essential health data securely, so I can receive personalized care and support.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires controlling and limiting data sharing to prevent unwanted interactions (forbidding unrestricted sharing), whereas User Story B demands continuous automatic sharing of all health data. These impose incompatible constraints on data sharing under the same operational context.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control ALFREDs social features to honor each clients privacy and prevent unwanted interactions, so I can support meaningful connections safely.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are adjusted to allow controlled and consent-based data sharing that balances privacy concerns with the need for continuous health monitoring, enabling configurable sharing permissions.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to control data sharing permissions in ALFRED to protect privacy while enabling meaningful connections safely.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to continuously monitor and share health data based on my consent, so I stay informed and supported.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual control to potentially restrict notifications to protect privacy, effectively forbidding some data sharing, while User Story B requires sharing all personal health data freely, which forbids stopping data sharing under any circumstances.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose which ALFRED notifications I receive, so that I can manage my workload and protect my clients' privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share all my personal health data freely, so that I can fully benefit from personalized care and support.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to balance privacy control with necessary data sharing by allowing manual notification preferences while enabling essential health data sharing for personalized care.
newUserStoryASummary: As a caregiver, I want to control which ALFRED notifications I receive, so I can protect privacy while supporting care needs.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older person, I want ALFRED to share essential personal health data to enable personalized care, while respecting my privacy settings.

conflictDescription: User Story A requires manual control to choose which notifications to receive, effectively forbidding automatic or continuous notifications to prevent overload and protect privacy, while User Story B mandates automatic continuous monitoring and sharing of all health data to keep the user fully informed. These contradict as one forbids continuous automatic notifications and the other requires them.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose which ALFRED notifications I receive, so that I can manage my workload and protect my clients' privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to automatically monitor and share all my health data continuously so I can stay fully informed and supported.
resolutionDescription: The conflict is resolved by defining automatic continuous monitoring with configurable notification preferences, allowing caregivers to manually select notifications to avoid overload while keeping users informed.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to customize which ALFRED notifications I receive, so that I can manage workload and respect privacy.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to continuously monitor health data and send notifications based on my preferences, so I stay informed without overload.

conflictDescription: User Story A implies manual control to limit or prevent receiving certain notifications for privacy and workload reasons, effectively forbidding some data-driven notifications, while User Story B expects ALFRED to use all shared health data to provide personalized support, mandating operation using full data without restriction. These two requirements conflict because one forbids certain data sharing/notification operations under any circumstance, while the other mandates full data use for personalized operations.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to manually choose which ALFRED notifications I receive, so that I can manage my workload and protect my clients' privacy.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want ALFRED to use all my shared health data to provide personalized and challenging support for my well-being.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to allow manual control over notifications while enabling use of shared health data for personalization, balancing privacy and support.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to select which ALFRED notifications I receive, so I can manage workload and respect privacy preferences.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to use my shared health data within allowed limits to provide personalized support for my well-being.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to allow initiated video calls by caregivers for health assessment, while User Story B implies spontaneous chats initiated by older adults with random strangers, which could conflict if the system restricts such spontaneous chats during caregiver-initiated calls due to interruptions or privacy. The conflict arises because both require opposite operations on video call initiation under overlapping conditions.
userStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to initiate video calls with patients for health assessments to quickly monitor their wellbeing during busy shifts without non-critical interruptions.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want to chat spontaneously with random strangers through ALFRED to reduce loneliness and feel socially connected.
resolutionDescription: Both user stories are updated to clarify context-aware video call initiation and restrictions to avoid interruptions and privacy issues, allowing caregiver calls during health assessments and spontaneous chats outside these periods.
newUserStoryASummary: As a registered nurse, I want to initiate video calls for health assessments during scheduled times to monitor wellbeing without interruptions.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want to chat spontaneously with random strangers when not in caregiver calls to reduce loneliness and feel socially connected.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects caregivers to join game sessions with patients, while User Story B expects older adults to spontaneously chat with strangers, implying different and potentially conflicting social interaction modes triggered by the system under user-initiated activities.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver managing multiple clients, I want to join game sessions with my patients to encourage emotional engagement and strengthen our bond.
userStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want to chat spontaneously with random strangers through ALFRED to reduce loneliness and feel socially connected.
resolutionDescription: The user stories are updated to specify distinct social interaction modes and contexts, avoiding conflicting triggers by allocating caregiver involvement in structured game sessions, and spontaneous stranger chats as optional user-initiated activities.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to join scheduled game sessions with patients to encourage engagement and strengthen bonds.
newUserStoryBSummary: As a tech-curious older adult, I want to optionally chat spontaneously with strangers to reduce loneliness and feel connected.

conflictDescription: User Story A expects the system to proactively suggest or engage patients with games to support well-being, while User Story B forbids ALFRED from suggesting activities unless explicitly asked by the user, creating opposing instructions for the same triggering event of activity suggestion.
userStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want to use simple and enjoyable games to emotionally engage my clients and support their well-being without causing stress.
userStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to never suggest activities unless I explicitly ask, so that I keep full control over my tasks.
resolutionDescription: User Story A is refined to suggest games proactively only with user consent or in specific contexts, while User Story B is updated to allow suggestions when explicitly permitted, balancing proactive engagement with user control.
newUserStoryASummary: As an informal caregiver, I want ALFRED to suggest enjoyable games to users with their consent, so that I can support well-being without causing stress.
newUserStoryBSummary: As an older adult, I want ALFRED to suggest activities only when I explicitly allow or request them, so that I keep control over my tasks.
